abstract.p: South Korea's finance minister, Jin Nyum, pledges accelerated effort to clean up nation's troubled banks and businesses; photo (S)

block.p: South Korea's newly appointed minister of finance and economy, Jin Nyum, promised an accelerated effort to clean up the nation's troubled banks and businesses. Mr. Jin, the former planning and budget minister, was appointed finance minister as part of a broad cabinet shakeup. He is under intense pressure to require big conglomerates like Hyundai and Daewoo to pay billions of dollars in loans. Mr. Jin projected that the nation's economy would grow 8 percent this year, in line with a forecast of the previous cabinet.
